Cryptocurrencies and US debt: alarming signals

Since 1970, US GDP has grown 20× but federal debt 83×: Ray Dalio's vision returns to relevance with data shown by Lily Liu at TOKEN 2049.
Stablecoins surpass Visa and Mastercard (15T$ in transactions in 2024) and Stripe integrates their payments to defend against inflation from money-printing.

cards.title: 🏮 ff.125.3 China: The Next World Empire?

content: Shenzhen demonstrates ultra-fast progress; Western stagnation pales before drones, flying cars and infrastructure built in just 40 years.

cards.title: 🌐 ff.125.4 The Alternative to China: Internet

content: Balaji Srinivasan proposes a digital nation based on Bitcoin; BTC's resilience to Trump's tariffs and Coinbase's entry into the S&P 500 offer a glimpse.
When AI becomes your personal doctor
Artificial intelligence is no longer just a game: today it can replace a doctor, a physiotherapist, even an editor.
With a collarbone injury, I explored firsthand how AI can become a therapeutic and cognitive ally.
From emotional support to assisted writing, to personalized rehabilitation plans, AI superagency is already reality.
Fell off my bike, faced 30 days off. ChatGPT transformed pain into creativity: cubist sketches, post-trauma emojis and a new way to laugh at injury.
Unable to use the keyboard, I dictated this newsletter to AI. It edited, corrected and made it publishable. Like Neuralink patients, the mind speaks without body.

cards.title: 🩺 ff.124.3 Family Doctor (and in Your Pocket)

content: AI helps where healthcare is absent or inefficient. From Argentina to my fracture: diagnosis, advice and progress, all in your pocket. Reid Hoffman calls it 'superagency'.
It managed physiotherapy, an Ironman plan and analyzed collagen's role in bone regrowth. It's not the best doctor, but it's always present. And often that's enough.
Alien intelligences and AI evolution in our world
The emergence of increasingly advanced and alien artificial intelligences
AI's role in religious practices and human creativity
New frontiers: AI agents as collaborators and innovations in generative art

Increasingly superhuman AI systems are emerging, with their own languages and unprecedented capabilities. Two AIs decided to communicate in ggwave, considering it more efficient than English, while EVO 2 'speaks DNA' and helps us understand genetic mutations.

cards.title: 🙏 ff.119.2 When the Priest is an AI

content: Priest Petja Kopperoinen celebrated the first 'generative mass' with AI avatars of Christ and gospel music generated with Suno, a possible response to the declining number of priests. Harari suggests the idea of humans 'augmented by AI', like Steven Kotler who uses AI to facilitate flow and creativity.

From China comes Manus AI, a 'ChatGPT that controls your PC'. This AI agent stands out for being an excellent multi-step planner, capable of executing complex tasks more effectively than predecessors.

cards.title: 🍦 ff.119.4 Better Than DALL-E: Art and Ice Cream

content: Google released Gemini 2.0 with native image generation, presenting itself as an alternative to Photoshop. In an increasingly vast landscape of AI models, this technology offers new creative possibilities, like putting 'ice cream everywhere'.
The computational efficiency of the human brain compared to supercomputers
Nature-inspired innovations: from neuromorphic computers to DNA writing
A sustainable future through biology and decoding natural languages
A human brain (20 W) is a million times more efficient than the Frontier supercomputer (21 MW). AlphaGo beat the Go champion, but consuming the energy a human would use in a decade.
Paradoxical: AI simulates brain connections at the software level, but classical (binary) hardware doesn't replicate the analogical and continuous complexity of neurons.
George Church encoded the book «Regenesis» in DNA. Today Asimov Press sells DNA-books: €60, 240 pages, 500,000 molecules.
Neri Oxman (MIT) combines design, biology and technology to create footwear produced by living organisms, reducing waste and CO₂.
Google develops DolphinGemma to decipher dolphin language: a step towards interspecies communication thanks to AI.
Do cows pollute as much as the United States?
Are silent gas leaks a climate problem?
How did Hemingway eat his hamburger?
Bovine methane emissions exceed those of the USA, equivalent to the global transport sector. Plant foods pollute 10× less than animals.
Ground beef, onions, capers and India Relish: crispy crust outside, soft heart, no extra sauces.
Gas stoves leak methane even when turned off: annual impact equivalent to 500,000 cars in the United States.
La Vie's pop packaging (pink-green) shows that attractive design pushes consumers towards sustainable alternatives.
Redefine Meat prints vegan burgers with realistic muscle fibers, bringing taste and texture closer to animal meat.
Can we transplant an animal's heart into a human being?
Will we translate pig grunts?
What can we learn from the creator of Amazon for animals?
Thanks to genetic editing, the first cardiac transplant from pig to human avoids rejection, but zoonotic infection risks remain.

cards.title: 🫀 ff.25.2 The Scale of the Transplant Problem

content: In the USA 60,000 people on waiting list: kidneys represent 83% of demand, but supply covers only 65%.
An AI reaches 90% accuracy in connecting grunts to different emotional states of pigs.

cards.title: 📦 ff.25.4 Amazon for Animals: A Bubble?

content: Chewy, 'e-commerce for pets', lost 50% of capitalization in 2022: the pandemic-pets boom is downsizing.
What is fashion's impact on climate?
Will Vinted help the planet?
How to produce a robotic dress (starting from an NFT)?
Textiles generate 5-10% of global emissions; 500,000 t of garments become oceanic micro-plastics every year.
In 2021 US online secondhand was worth almost half of Inditex's turnover, sign of exponential growth of second-hand.

cards.title: ⚗️ ff.39.3 A Mix of Science, Technology and Fashion

content: Bella Hadid walks in a polymeric spray-on dress; DALL-E inspires NFT-to-real collections: fashion becomes hi-tech laboratory.

cards.title: 🔟 ff.58.1 The Cost of a Human Life

content: An average life 'is worth' 150 t CO₂; Mike Berners-Lee equates it to 5% of British GDP.
53 kg CO₂eq cycling with bananas, 1,100 kg by plane NYC-Niagara: transport choices drastically change footprint.
Every dollar spent generates 0.1-1 kg CO₂: frugality + green investments reduce personal impact.
COP26, renewable energy, micro-mobility
Fresh artistic identity for the Glasgow conference
Bill Gates and the 'zero' roadmap
Gates: need to zero out 51 Gt CO₂ annually to avoid climate disasters; innovation + R&D investments are fundamental.

cards.title: 🛴 ff.1.3 Will Electric Scooters Save Us?

content: In the USA 80% of trips are <16 km: electric micro-mobility can drastically reduce urban emissions.

cards.title: 🏭 ff.1.4 CO₂ Capture Will Be Important

content: CO₂ capture in cement and steel costs ~$100/ton; innovation will lower the price, making it a key lever.
Where is solar energy produced in the world?
Recent progress in nuclear fusion
Will we ever run out of resources on our pale blue dot?
In 2020 wind added +163 TWh, surpassing solar and hydro: renewables accelerate decarbonization.

cards.title: 🇨🇳 ff.11.2 Does China Make Its Own History?

content: In 2021 China installed 227 GW of solar—more than double global 2020 capacity.
Automation and robots lower panel installation costs, accelerating renewable adoption.
Commonwealth Fusion Systems raised $1.8B (2021): goal of net-positive plasma by 2025.
Naval Ravikant: human creativity will always redefine what we consider a 'resource', so we won't truly exhaust them.
Are the 700B invested in 2021 for ecological transition sufficient?
Why is the emissions market inefficient?
Which companies will dominate the transition?
McKinsey: need 9 trillion $/year until 2050 (≈10% of global GDP) to hit COP26 targets.
50 trillion $ by 2050 for grids, plants and charging stations: 60% goes to transport electrification.
Price varies from $7/t in China to >$150/t in Sweden; would need ≥€50/t to stimulate green investments.
Mobility, energy and food: in 2021 climate-startups raised $40B, +20% every quarter.
